intro: Gymnandropogon tristis, commonly known as the slender panicgrass, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense clusters at the tips of the stems. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and along stream banks. Gymnandropogon tristis is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator species for certain wetland environments.
